Exciting news at Lumentum ‚Äì we‚Äôve agreed to acquire NeoPhotonics to expand our opportunity in the fast-growing market for high-speed optical components used in cloud and telecom network infrastructure. This transaction is another important investment in better serving our customers and expanding our photonics capabilities at a time when photonics are at the forefront of favorable long-term market trends. Together, we‚Äôll help our customers compete and win in their respective markets. Read more here: https://bit.ly/3q4K9Uw

Under the proposed terms, promptly after filing its proxy statement with the SEC, NeoPhotonics will mail or otherwise make available the proxy statement and a proxy card to each stockholder entitled to vote at the annual meeting relating to the proposed transaction. As we wrap up #AAPIMonth, we wanted to celebrate some prominent Asian American and Pacific Islander American figures throughout history. We hope their accomplishments will inspire, educate, and encourage all of you to cherish the AAPI community and stand with them against anti-Asian racism. ‚úä

üîπ Norman Mineta

Norman Mineta has served as U.S. Congressman, Secretary of Transportation, Secretary of Commerce, and also as councilman for and mayor of San Jose.  Mineta also established the Congressional Asian Pacific American Caucus to ensure the needs of the Asian American and Pacific Islander community were met.

üî∏ Narinder Singh Kapany

Dr. Kapany became the first Sikh Indian to take a company public in Silicon Valley. He is credited with coining the phrase ‚Äúfiber optics‚Äù and was the first to successfully transmit high-quality images through a bundle of optical fibers.

üîπ Charles Kuen Kao

Dr. Kao discovered that bundles of thin fibers could be manufactured from glass, allowing it to carry huge amounts of information over long distances. For his work, Dr. Kao received the 2009 Nobel Prize in Physics.

üî∏ Chien-Shiung Wu

Chien-Shiung Wu is an Asian American pioneer in scientific research and in academia. Her nicknames include the "First Lady of Physics," the "Chinese Madame Curie," and the "Queen of Nuclear Research."

üîπ Yuri Kochiyama

Yuri Kochiyama was a lifelong champion of civil rights causes in the Black, Latinx, Native American, and Asian-American communities. Her lifelong commitment to justice and civil rights for all has inspired multiple AAPI generations to always speak up against injustice.

üî∏ Grace Lee Boggs

Grace Lee Boggs was an activist and writer for civil rights, labor, feminism, the environment, and other causes for over seven decades. Her work has shown us that the path to equality is a lifelong, continuous, and courageous journey.

Our Milan site in Italy houses a newly designed conference room, office space, cafeteria, and break room. All of which run on 100% renewable energy, reflecting our corporate social responsibility and sustainability goals. https://t.co/vcCReeNYxC

At Lumentum, we remain committed to ensuring employees and their dependents receive access to critical healthcare that aligns with their personal choices, wherever they reside.

In response to the U.S. Supreme Court‚Äôs overturning of Roe v. Wade, Lumentum now includes a travel reimbursement with a lifetime cap of up to $10,000 for employees and their dependents in the United States who are unable to access critical reproductive health services in the state in which they reside. 

We are also reviewing our global policies around both access to coverage and travel reimbursement in light of our U.S. response.

Now and in the future, the health and wellbeing of our employees around the world is our top priority, and we will do our best to ensure that our actions reflect that commitment.

This summer, Lumentum's intern program was unlike any year in the past. With COVID-19 as an intimate concern, our intern class was unable to work from our offices or meet in person.

However, we are thrilled we could continue our program virtually! Like every other year, our #LumentumInterns had the chance to work on meaningful projects, participate in fun intern events, and interact with each other, full-time employees, and the executive team.

1. Pin Red ‚ù§Ô∏è where they've been working from remotely this summer

üíµ On June 23, Lumentum Thailand made a 750,000 baht ($25,000 USD) donation to support the educational development of students in Pathumthani Province. 
 
üè´ At a celebratory event held at Intaranaweeratupatham School, Lumentum Thailand's leadership team had the pleasure of tasting local delicacies, watching student performances, and witnessing the vibrant school community alongside government and Red Cross officials.
